text: The people working here need to work on their customer service. They kind of acted sarcastic towards me and like I was a bother. I know everybody has bad days though and the smoothie wasn't half bad, but really, work on being personable and customer service. I will try to stop in again :)
Great menu, bad execution and customer service. Please hire somebody competent and customer friendly

Je crois que je n'ai qu'un seul mot: hummmmmmmmmmmm! Très gouttus! Les fruits et moi ça fait un, ça fusionne! Alors je ne vous raconte pas les smoothies comme je les aime. Ceux de Liquid Nutrition sont exquis. J'ai eu l'occasion de les tester, lorsque je participais à une étude sur un baume à lèvre. Alors vous comprendrez bien que durant la journée, nous ne pouvions pas manger de choses solides pour éviter d'enlever le baume à lèvre sur notre lèvres. C'est pourquoi la compagnie de test de produits cosmétiques nous a donné comme repas des smoothies enrichis! Un vrai régal!

Good place to go after a solid work out, tons of supplements to fulfill your needs and great service by their knowledgeable employees (can't vouch for every single one, but the one I've been dealing with most recently is great).   I'd much rather make my own at home, which is why I don't frequent juice/smoothie bars often, but if I need to replenish fast then I'll just pop in and pick up a Pure or Decadent smoothie.
Nice and small shop. A quiet place to study and have a healthy drink.   They have a student menu with really good prices and various options. 5-6$ for a big size.

I can't say much about this place - nothing personal just wasn't my thing. Maybe it was an off day.  I ordered a smoothie that just didn't have much taste to it- and the taste that it had was not very good. It tasted super healthy, the only problem is that it didn't taste GOOD. My friend ordered something completely different and his was as equally disappointing. The price didn't help.  These guys might be unto something but they just need to get their flavor profiles down.

This little place was a breathe of fresh (and healthy) air after a trip to Parc du Mont-Royal. We were ready for a light lunch. I enjoyed the Banana Chocolate Whey Protein smoothie and felt rejuvenated after finishing it.  They have numerous varieties and sizes of smoothies and juices plus some packaged items. My friend purchased several packs of gluten free cookies which she kindly shared with me later.    It's all about health here so ask when you are not sure what to order.  One of us ended up with something very healthy but not so tasty.  The service could have been a little friendlier and engaging, but I'm live in Texas where that is almost always the norm.

Have bombed by 100's of times without spotting this oasis. Thankful for the stop light at Drummond while zipping along the Maisonnueve bike lane to Westmount this afternoon. Kept it in mind for the return trip, and took a Concordia friend along for catchup drinks.    2 shots of fresh pressed wheatgrass to start and my friend ordered the Wow!, which she loved, while I had the Recuperation Vitale _ an internal balm for my nearly 6 decades very used knees =D.   Total upper: great company, magic elixirs, and a sweet ride in the sharpening angled sunlight.   Jonathan is knowledgeable about his product, a pleasure, and runs a tip top biz.   =D so Vancouver!  Except, honestly, more expensive than my usual spot on Robson St! By about 5$ for the whole bill.    Will be back for more high octane imbibing.

This place is an oasis for those of us who try to juice while travelling.  I had a great shot of wheatgrass (dirt grown for better nutrition), a ginger shot to kick my cold in its ass, and a great smoothie recommended by the owner.  I felt better in no time! I highly recommend this place for travellers and local juicers alike.

Super overpriced and the smoothies literally have no taste. I've tried them on various occasions and I'm always disappointed. I've tried the smoothie that is also available in a bowl, the dragon fruit one. I purchase the dragon fruit puree from them and make my own smoothies at home and theyre amazing, and I get the exact same thing there are it literally tastes like water... Save your money and go to Jugo Juice because at least their smoothies have flavour.
Amazing place!! Love love to bottles juices .super tasty . and they make great shakes too . staff is super nice and helpful too

I mostly go to the Liquid Nutrition in Cours Mont Royal although I've been to the one on Guy a couple times.  They serve all kinds of smoothies and meal replacements, protein powders, vitamins, wheatgrass shots and other foods for the health conscious person. My favorite are their milk-based smoothies either made with regular milk or almond/soy milks. The menu has changed a bit over the years but they keep a wide selection and when you walk in the store, you can easily read and understand what every drink is made of.  I've tried their "Early Bird" meal placements which are on the pricier side and do make you feel full but unfortunately don't taste so great. The chocolate or vanilla flavored protein powders is something I'll never be a fan of.  Compared to Jugo Juice, Liquid Nutrition is actually cheaper and has more variety.  It's something I like to treat myself with once in a while - I can easily make these at home but when you're outside and feel like something refreshing or a snack, this does the job.

Concept intéressant. J'ai essayé le Voltage (9.20 $ avec taxes). Le goût n'a rien d'extraodinaire. On présente ça comme des "milk-shake-repas" mais je doute que ça soit assez consistant ou bien équilibré pour constituer un repas. On indique le nombre de calories + prot pour chaque shake et le plus calorifique ne dépasse pas 600 Cal ce qui est vraiment limite pour un repas. Les boissons sont servies froides et on se gèles lois doigts à tenir le contenant en plastique. Je pense qu'un meilleurs prix m'inciterait à revenir mais je ne mettrais pas plus que 4.5 $ pour boire la même chose. Sinon autant aller manger dans un des nombreux petits restaurants asiatique.

Vraiment cool comme concept! J'adore me faire des smoothies à la maison parce que je sais quels ingrédients y sont et souvent quand j'ai le goût de m'en acheter un au lieu de faire le mien, je cherche les endroits où les ingrédients sont clairement indiqués. Par contre, dans bien des bars à jus communs, ils ont souvent l'air d'utiliser de la crème glacée ou du gelato comme base, mais moi ce que je vais c'est un "repas liquide" sans sucres ajoutés et c'est ce que j'ai trouvé chez Liquid Nutrition.  Les smoothies sont très bons, même sans crème glacée. En fait, je les préfère de loin! Les ingrédients sont tous frais, on n'y ajoute pas de glace ou de bananes pas chères pour "remplir" votre smoothie et ça coûte environ la même chose que chez leur compétiteurs. Vous pouvez aussi demander pour des suppléments naturels (protéines, vitamines, etc.) et ils ont même des versions spéciales pour ceux qui sont végétaliens! Assez rare de voir ça dans une chaîne de smoothie!  Le service est super bien et vous pouvez facilement poser toutes les questions qui vous passent par la tête et recevoir une réponse éduquée. Les Liquid Nutrition sont originaires de Montréal (yay!) et ils gagnent en popularité alors ça ne me surprendrait pas d'en voir un peu partout dans quelques années.
Bonne petite place pour prendre un smoothie.  Grande variété, service  rapide. On peut acheter des biscuits et muffins. Tout est végan. Il y a aussi des poudres protéinées et vitamines.
